page.title: 12Rt.Hon.Boscawen:constituency
page.content: {MP's,}as well as having much responsibility in Parliament and in the party, also have a very great social commitment.They must attend important social functions, their {'surgeries',}and in the time of campaign,they must visit people to gain popularity. They are also committed to answering every letter that is sent to them. This takes,on average, two hours per day,and he has to employ 2 secretaries to cope with them. M.P.s,depending on their distance away from Westminster, are given{travel allowances}for car, train, and for very distant M.P.s, air travel. Parliamentary sessions are only held on weekdays so most M.P.s return to their{constituencies}at the week_ends. On some Fridays it is not absolutely necessary for the Whips to be there until the close.
